newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's department store sales up 5.1 pct in Feb.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's department store sales up 5.1 pct in Feb.

text.p: Mexico's department store sales rose 5.1 percent in February while self-service store sales dropped 2.0 percent compared with the same month last year, the National Association of Self-Service and Department Stores said on Tuesday.
The association said the 2 percent drop in self-service store sales "should be interpreted as a regression not a recovery."
It compares with a drop of 18.2 percent in February 1996, and a 5.5 percent fall in January of this year.
"It is expected that as of March the drop will be slower...and there will be the beginning of a recovery of lost ground," Antad said.
At department stores, sales rose somewhat more than the 4.4 percent increase in January. That, Antad said, may suggest the first signs of recovery.
